oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Spoilt for choice — is organic milk really any different?
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Butler, Gillian
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Food security, food quality and human health
Dairy cattle
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Many of us buy organic milk and other produce simply through a gut feeling that “it is better for you”. We base our feeling on little more than prejudice. But it is a widespread prejudice: demand for organic milk grew by 40 million litres last year. Are there any grounds for that prejudice? And what does “better for you” mean? Gillian Butler has the evidence.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Butler, Gillian (2008) Spoilt for choice — is organic milk really any different? significance, pp. 104-107.
